result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Latonyia L Blanton in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case to follow 15CM1306. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case adjourned to branch 24 for a Plea and Sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Latonyia L Blanton in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.15(91).  The Court orders (and by stipulation of the parties) that Dr. Deborah Collins be appointed to examine the defendant pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.16(2).  Order Appointing Doctor signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for Return on the Doctor's Report.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.   
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.F. and C.F.

Defendant Latonyia L Blanton in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 10-14-15 @ 1:30 pm
